column4: Hi I need some assistance. I have a PC with a SCSI Cd drive , IDE harddrives, no floppy and a nic that doesn't sup[ort network boots. The SCSI controller does not support bootable cd. Would someone help me get Ubuntu installed. It currently runs a dual boot of 2003 server and FreeDos but in Freedos it won't see the CD drive. I did copy the contents of the iso into the root of FreeDos's C
when you say "nic dosn't support" have you seen the boot floppy that loads what is normaly in a PXE boot rom?
http://rom-o-matic.net
how would I get that image into the system there is no floppy drive
ouch.  good q
does it boot any linux right now?
no just 2003 server and FreeDOS. To install FreeDos I had to put a 16 gig IDE drive in and use VMServer then mount the physical drive
can I use loadlin from FreeDos to somehow kickstart the install?
maybe.  I just discovered kexec, which loads and runs kernels from a booted linux
which lets me wget the netboot kernel/initrd and run it, which starts the installer (it just takes over the system)
give me a sec... I'll dig up the URL's I used.  worth a shot
kexec sounds great to me but I need something that runs under 2003 or Dos
you mentioned loadlin... may be the same thing as kexec
find me a URL describing loadlin - I am interested.  pm it to me if you can - I am switching to another box for a min or 2
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/LocalNet
no msg here.  may be because one of us (like me) isn't registered
check out the bottem of that page - I just added the wget commands for where you can get the installer.  see if that works with loadlin
can you E-mail me the address of that app to emanuel.levy@gmail.com I'm going to try to install dsl-linux then use that app to bet ubuntu up
or anyone - what is the URL lor Loadlin?
not now - my main box is running memcheck
how will you install dsl?
i never got a reply to: how can you install dsl on a box with no boot devices?
